meanings.definition: The act of throwing or casting something with force.
meanings.sent1: He showed off his strength with a powerful windthrows of the ball.
meanings.sent2: The windthrows of the stone into the pond created ripples.
meanings.sent3: The windthrows of the paper airplane contest were quite impressive.
meanings.sent4: Her windthrows of ideas in the meeting caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The windthrows of the hammer echoed through the workshop.

meanings.definition: Trees or branches that have been uprooted or broken by the wind.
meanings.sent1: After the storm, the forest was filled with windthrows of fallen trees.
meanings.sent2: The windthrows of branches made the path impassable.
meanings.sent3: The windthrows of the trees looked like a giant game of pick-up sticks.
meanings.sent4: The windthrows of the branches resembled a chaotic jigsaw puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The windthrows of the trees revealed the power of the storm.
